intro: Dufrenoya euryphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved dufrenoya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
